Description: Gilded cartonnage mummy-mask of young man; blue glass eye-brows(right lost); obsidian and white stone eyes set in bronze casing; painted scenes on sides and back; pitch scarab on forehead; separate chest-piece of gilded cartonnage with low relief and painted decoration.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Published: S. Walker and M. Bierbrier, Fayum. Misteriosi volti dall'Egitto, London 1997, p. 100 [71].
Bibliographic references: Parlasca & Seeman 1999 / Augenblicke. Mumienporträts und ägyptische Grabkunst aus römischer Zeit (p.104, no. 3)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1997 22 Oct-1998 30 Apr, Italy, Rome, Fondaione Memmo, Ancient Faces
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum (Trustees of)
